Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has enough water and is healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant that does not have enough water and is wilting or not growing well.
The student can show patterns by illustrating the difference between a well-watered plant and a plant that lacks water.
The student can represent that plants need water by showing the effects of different water levels on plant growth in their drawings.
The student can use their drawing to identify that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can connect their observation drawings to show that when plants receive water, they are healthier compared to when they do not.
